returns._0: stotage value for the given account at the given index
amount of storage gas available to the caller
the number of transactions issued by the given external account or the account sequence number of the given contract
true if the caller of this was called directly from L1
address of the caller's caller, without applying L1 contract address aliasing
a unique identifier for this L2-to-L1 transaction.
true iff the caller's address is an alias for an L1 contract address
unique identifier for this L2-to-L1 transaction.

arbBlockNumber().notice: Get Arbitrum block number (distinct from L1 block number; Arbitrum genesis block has block number 0)

arbOSVersion().notice: Get internal version number identifying an ArbOS build

getStorageAt(address,uint256).notice: get the value of target L2 storage slot This function is only callable from address 0 to prevent contracts from being able to call it

getStorageGasAvailable().notice: get the caller's amount of available storage gas

getTransactionCount(address).notice: get the number of transactions issued by the given external account or the account sequence number of the given contract

isTopLevelCall().notice: check if current call is coming from l1

mapL1SenderContractAddressToL2Alias(addr.notice: map L1 sender contract address to its L2 alias

myCallersAddressWithoutAliasing().notice: return the address of the caller (of this caller of this), without applying L1 contract address aliasing

wasMyCallersAddressAliased().notice: check if the caller (of this caller of this) is an aliased L1 contract address

withdrawEth(address).notice: Send given amount of Eth to dest from sender. This is a convenience function, which is equivalent to calling sendTxToL1 with empty calldataForL1.
